results.title: This is what will happen when Trump is arrested in the coming days.
results.abstract: Donald J. Trump will likely face standard processing when he is taken into custody, but the unprecedented arrest of a former commander in chief will be anything but routine.

media.caption: Donald J. Trump in Salem, N.H., in January. After his arrest is processed, the former president is likely to be released on his own recognizance because the indictment likely contains only nonviolent felony charges.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times

results.title: A President Faces Prosecution, and a Democracy Is Tested
results.abstract: For more than two centuries, American presidents were effectively shielded from indictment. But the case against former President Donald J. Trump breaks that taboo and sets a new precedent.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump could also face indictments in Georgia and from federal prosecutors.
media.copyright: Doug Mills/The New York Times
